meanings.definition: To deprive of an endowment or endowments.
meanings.sent1: The charity decided to disendow the scholarship fund.
meanings.sent2: She was disendowing the museum of its valuable artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved disendowing the hat of its rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to disendow the trees of their leaves overnight.
meanings.sent5: The evil sorcerer's curse disendowed the kingdom of its prosperity.

meanings.definition: To divest of an endowment or endowments.
meanings.sent1: The university board voted to disendow the research center.
meanings.sent2: The court order required them to disendow the trust fund.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's plan was to disendow the birthday gift of its wrapping.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis seemed to disendow the company of its stability.
meanings.sent5: The drought threatened to disendow the river of its life-giving water.
